function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Observed covariance matrices are not equal between different construction groups","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Significance and non-significance of multivariate tests can influence the interpretation of the study results","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The proportion of participants is significantly higher in continental europe","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The measures in design and construction have the highest score in all three types of buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The studied methods have the highest scores in high and very high-risk buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Examination of the effect of implementing prevention methods on different types of buildings may lead to the spread of contagious diseases if the methods are not effective or if the buildings are not properly managed.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty of the population size of the study","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Random sampling selection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty of collecting information","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper training and guidance on covid-19 exposure sources and prevention measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible lack of effective preventive measures in the real estate industry","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on outdated prevention and control methods","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of risk assessment and management in building services maintenance","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systemic study on covid-19 response in the built environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient knowledge and guidance on combating covid-19 in facilities management","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear relation between environmental contamination and clinical infection","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission route through stool viral shedding","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate decontamination measures for air outlets and equipment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 in warmer climates","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hvac system potentially contributing to airborne pathogen transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in air and on surfaces in healthcare environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in covid-19 risk levels","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of temperature on virus spread","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data collection and analysis during the pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in health and safety risks based on work environment outdoors vs. enclosed","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Interdependent relation between health and the built environment in controlling covid-19 spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown factors in the management of covid-19 pandemic and its impact on property management","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of epidemic diseases impacting sustainable development","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Model 1 not adjusted for employment status in models estimating sickness benefit transfers","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Model 2 not adjusted for chronic conditions, any psychiatric condition, and physical activity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of diagnosis related groups charges and outpatient charges for unit cost estimates may not accurately capture the full cost of treatment.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on market price for prescription medicines may not reflect the actual cost incurred by the healthcare system.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible underestimation of the impact of long-term sick leave on productivity and economic costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conservative estimation of the cost reductions associated with flourishing over the short-term, without considering long-term flourishing","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Need to disclose potential conflicts of interest and financial relationships related to the submitted work","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Missing data on alcohol consumption, smoking, and nutrition could lead to unadjusted factors and potential mediators in the analysis.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible overadjustment in the analytical models by accounting for past healthcare utilization and health status, leading to biased results.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of generalizability to other countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequalities in response rates based on gender, age, education, marital status, employment, immigration status, and income","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decline in flourishing prevalence contributing to escalating healthcare expenditure.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential lack of causal evidence for relationship between mental health and healthcare expenditure","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hypothetical scenario of moving population to a flourishing state","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between well-being and lower healthcare costs and sickness benefit transfers","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extrapolation of findings to the entire danish population","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the confidence intervals of the estimated costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High prevalence of flourishing declined significantly","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between low flourishing and high healthcare utilization","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Baseline well-being associated with higher future healthcare costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevalence of a contagious disease may not be accurately reported in the text","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
